title: UK's damaged 'speed limit' for growth could hamper Bank of England lowering rates, says deputy Governor
text:
The UK’s “speed limit” for growth has been so damaged by uncertainty over Brexit that it could hamper the Bank of England’s ability to help a weak economy with lower interest rates, deputy Governor Sir Dave Ramsden warned today.

Sir Dave voiced his concerns over plunging business investment and productivity in a Telegraph interview that underlines splits on the Bank’s Monetary Policy Committee little more than two weeks before Boris Johnson’s “do or die” October 31 deadline for leaving the European Union.
